message.content:
To extract a three character code like "1Jn" from a filename in format "57-1Jn.usfm", you can use this regular expression:

^(?!\.)[A-Za-z0-9]{3,3}\.usfm$

Breaking it down:

1. ^(?!\.) - Negative lookahead to ensure the code is not followed by a period (to avoid extracting file extensions).
2. [A-Za-z0-9]{3} - This part of the regex matches three characters from the given character set, which includes upper and lower case letters as well as digits. The {3} portion limits the match to exactly three characters.
